14 assert_almost_equal, assert_array_almost_equal,
15 assert_allclose, assert_, assert_warns,
16 assert_array_less, suppress_warnings, IS_PYPY)

27 cumulative_trapezoid)

40DOCSTRINGS_STRIPPED = sys.flags.optimize > 1

42# Failing on macOS 11, Intel CPUs. See gh-14901
43MACOS_INTEL = (sys.platform == 'darwin') and (platform.machine() == 'x86_64')

46# distributions to skip while testing the fix for the support method
47# introduced in gh-13294. These distributions are skipped as they
48# always return a non-nan support for every parametrization.
49skip_test_support_gh13294_regression = ['tukeylambda', 'pearson3']

51
52def _assert_hasattr(a, b, msg=None):
53 if msg is None:
54 msg = f'{a} does not have attribute {b}'
55 assert_(hasattr(a, b), msg=msg)
56
57
58def test_api_regression():
59 # https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/3802
60 _assert_hasattr(scipy.stats.distributions, 'f_gen')
61
62
63def test_distributions_submodule():
64 actual = set(scipy.stats.distributions.__all__)
65 continuous = [dist[0] for dist in distcont] # continuous dist names
66 discrete = [dist[0] for dist in distdiscrete] # discrete dist names
67 other = ['rv_discrete', 'rv_continuous', 'rv_histogram',
68 'entropy', 'trapz']
69 expected = continuous + discrete + other
70
71 # need to remove, e.g.,
72 # <scipy.stats._continuous_distns.trapezoid_gen at 0x1df83bbc688>
73 expected = set(filter(lambda s: not str(s).startswith('<'), expected))
74
75 assert actual == expected
76
77
78class TestVonMises:
79 @pytest.mark.parametrize('k', [0.1, 1, 101])
80 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x', [0, 1, np.pi, 10, 100])
81 def test_vonmises_periodic(self, k, x):
82 def check_vonmises_pdf_periodic(k, L, s, x):
83 vm = stats.vonmises(k, loc=L, scale=s)
84 assert_almost_equal(vm.pdf(x), vm.pdf(x % (2 * np.pi * s)))
85
86 def check_vonmises_cdf_periodic(k, L, s, x):
87 vm = stats.vonmises(k, loc=L, scale=s)
88 assert_almost_equal(vm.cdf(x) % 1,
89 vm.cdf(x % (2 * np.pi * s)) % 1)
90
91 check_vonmises_pdf_periodic(k, 0, 1, x)
92 check_vonmises_pdf_periodic(k, 1, 1, x)
93 check_vonmises_pdf_periodic(k, 0, 10, x)
94
95 check_vonmises_cdf_periodic(k, 0, 1, x)
96 check_vonmises_cdf_periodic(k, 1, 1, x)
97 check_vonmises_cdf_periodic(k, 0, 10, x)
98
99 def test_vonmises_line_support(self):
100 assert_equal(stats.vonmises_line.a, -np.pi)
101 assert_equal(stats.vonmises_line.b, np.pi)
102
103 def test_vonmises_numerical(self):
104 vm = stats.vonmises(800)
105 assert_almost_equal(vm.cdf(0), 0.5)
106
107 # Expected values of the vonmises PDF were computed using
108 # mpmath with 50 digits of precision:
109 #
110 # def vmpdf_mp(x, kappa):
111 # x = mpmath.mpf(x)
112 # kappa = mpmath.mpf(kappa)
113 # num = mpmath.exp(kappa*mpmath.cos(x))
114 # den = 2 * mpmath.pi * mpmath.besseli(0, kappa)
115 # return num/den
116
117 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, kappa, expected_pdf',
118 [(0.1, 0.01, 0.16074242744907072),
119 (0.1, 25.0, 1.7515464099118245),
120 (0.1, 800, 0.2073272544458798),
121 (2.0, 0.01, 0.15849003875385817),
122 (2.0, 25.0, 8.356882934278192e-16),
123 (2.0, 800, 0.0)])
124 def test_vonmises_pdf(self, x, kappa, expected_pdf):
125 pdf = stats.vonmises.pdf(x, kappa)
126 assert_allclose(pdf, expected_pdf, rtol=1e-15)
127
128 # Expected values of the vonmises entropy were computed using
129 # mpmath with 50 digits of precision:
130 #
131 # def vonmises_entropy(kappa):
132 # kappa = mpmath.mpf(kappa)
133 # return (-kappa * mpmath.besseli(1, kappa) /
134 # mpmath.besseli(0, kappa) + mpmath.log(2 * mpmath.pi *
135 # mpmath.besseli(0, kappa)))
136 # >>> float(vonmises_entropy(kappa))
137
138 @pytest.mark.parametrize('kappa, expected_entropy',
139 [(1, 1.6274014590199897),
140 (5, 0.6756431570114528),
141 (100, -0.8811275441649473),
142 (1000, -2.03468891852547),
143 (2000, -2.3813876496587847)])
144 def test_vonmises_entropy(self, kappa, expected_entropy):
145 entropy = stats.vonmises.entropy(kappa)
146 assert_allclose(entropy, expected_entropy, rtol=1e-13)
147
148 def test_vonmises_rvs_gh4598(self):
149 # check that random variates wrap around as discussed in gh-4598
150 seed = abs(hash('von_mises_rvs'))
151 rng1 = np.random.default_rng(seed)
152 rng2 = np.random.default_rng(seed)
153 rng3 = np.random.default_rng(seed)
154 rvs1 = stats.vonmises(1, loc=0, scale=1).rvs(random_state=rng1)
155 rvs2 = stats.vonmises(1, loc=2*np.pi, scale=1).rvs(random_state=rng2)
156 rvs3 = stats.vonmises(1, loc=0,
157 scale=(2*np.pi/abs(rvs1)+1)).rvs(random_state=rng3)
158 assert_allclose(rvs1, rvs2, atol=1e-15)
159 assert_allclose(rvs1, rvs3, atol=1e-15)
160
161 # Expected values of the vonmises LOGPDF were computed
162 # using wolfram alpha:
163 # kappa * cos(x) - log(2*pi*I0(kappa))
164 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, kappa, expected_logpdf',
165 [(0.1, 0.01, -1.8279520246003170),
166 (0.1, 25.0, 0.5604990605420549),
167 (0.1, 800, -1.5734567947337514),
168 (2.0, 0.01, -1.8420635346185686),
169 (2.0, 25.0, -34.7182759850871489),
170 (2.0, 800, -1130.4942582548682739)])
171 def test_vonmises_logpdf(self, x, kappa, expected_logpdf):
172 logpdf = stats.vonmises.logpdf(x, kappa)
173 assert_allclose(logpdf, expected_logpdf, rtol=1e-15)
174
175 def test_vonmises_expect(self):
176 """
177 Test that the vonmises expectation values are
178 computed correctly. This test checks that the
179 numeric integration estimates the correct normalization
180 (1) and mean angle (loc). These expectations are
181 independent of the chosen 2pi interval.
182 """
183 rng = np.random.default_rng(6762668991392531563)
184
185 loc, kappa, lb = rng.random(3) * 10
186 res = stats.vonmises(loc=loc, kappa=kappa).expect(lambda x: 1)
187 assert_allclose(res, 1)
188 assert np.issubdtype(res.dtype, np.floating)
189
190 bounds = lb, lb + 2 * np.pi
191 res = stats.vonmises(loc=loc, kappa=kappa).expect(lambda x: 1, *bounds)
192 assert_allclose(res, 1)
193 assert np.issubdtype(res.dtype, np.floating)
194
195 bounds = lb, lb + 2 * np.pi
196 res = stats.vonmises(loc=loc, kappa=kappa).expect(lambda x: np.exp(1j*x),
197 *bounds, complex_func=1)
198 assert_allclose(np.angle(res), loc % (2*np.pi))
199 assert np.issubdtype(res.dtype, np.complexfloating)
200
201 @pytest.mark.xslow
202 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_loc", [0, 2])
203 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_shape", [1, 100, 1e8])
204 @pytest.mark.parametrize('fix_loc', [True, False])
205 @pytest.mark.parametrize('fix_shape', [True, False])
206 def test_fit_MLE_comp_optimizer(self, rvs_loc, rvs_shape,
207 fix_loc, fix_shape):
208 if fix_shape and fix_loc:
209 pytest.skip("Nothing to fit.")
210
211 rng = np.random.default_rng(6762668991392531563)
212 data = stats.vonmises.rvs(rvs_shape, size=1000, loc=rvs_loc,
213 random_state=rng)
214
215 kwds = {'fscale': 1}
216 if fix_loc:
217 kwds['floc'] = rvs_loc
218 if fix_shape:
219 kwds['f0'] = rvs_shape
220
221 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.vonmises, data,
222 stats.vonmises.nnlf, **kwds)
223
224 @pytest.mark.parametrize('loc', [-0.5 * np.pi, 0, np.pi])
225 @pytest.mark.parametrize('kappa_tol', [(1e-1, 5e-2), (1e2, 1e-2),
226 (1e5, 1e-2)])
227 def test_vonmises_fit_all(self, kappa_tol, loc):
228 rng = np.random.default_rng(6762668991392531563)
229 kappa, tol = kappa_tol
230 data = stats.vonmises(loc=loc, kappa=kappa).rvs(100000,
231 random_state=rng)
232 kappa_fit, loc_fit, scale_fit = stats.vonmises.fit(data)
233 assert scale_fit == 1
234 loc_vec = np.array([np.cos(loc), np.sin(loc)])
235 loc_fit_vec = np.array([np.cos(loc_fit), np.sin(loc_fit)])
236 angle = np.arccos(loc_vec.dot(loc_fit_vec))
237 assert_allclose(angle, 0, atol=tol, rtol=0)
238 assert_allclose(kappa, kappa_fit, rtol=tol)
239
240 def test_vonmises_fit_shape(self):
241 rng = np.random.default_rng(6762668991392531563)
242 loc = 0.25*np.pi
243 kappa = 10
244 data = stats.vonmises(loc=loc, kappa=kappa).rvs(100000, random_state=rng)
245 kappa_fit, loc_fit, scale_fit = stats.vonmises.fit(data, floc=loc)
246 assert loc_fit == loc
247 assert scale_fit == 1
248 assert_allclose(kappa, kappa_fit, rtol=1e-2)
249
250 @pytest.mark.xslow
251 @pytest.mark.parametrize('loc', [-0.5 * np.pi, -0.9 * np.pi])
252 def test_vonmises_fit_bad_floc(self, loc):
253 data = [-0.92923506, -0.32498224, 0.13054989, -0.97252014, 2.79658071,
254 -0.89110948, 1.22520295, 1.44398065, 2.49163859, 1.50315096,
255 3.05437696, -2.73126329, -3.06272048, 1.64647173, 1.94509247,
256 -1.14328023, 0.8499056, 2.36714682, -1.6823179, -0.88359996]
257 data = np.asarray(data)
258 kappa_fit, loc_fit, scale_fit = stats.vonmises.fit(data, floc=loc)
259 assert kappa_fit == np.finfo(float).tiny
260 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.vonmises, data,
261 stats.vonmises.nnlf, fscale=1, floc=loc)
262
263 @pytest.mark.parametrize('sign', [-1, 1])
264 def test_vonmises_fit_unwrapped_data(self, sign):
265 rng = np.random.default_rng(6762668991392531563)
266 data = stats.vonmises(loc=sign*0.5*np.pi, kappa=10).rvs(100000,
267 random_state=rng)
268 shifted_data = data + 4*np.pi
269 kappa_fit, loc_fit, scale_fit = stats.vonmises.fit(data)
270 kappa_fit_shifted, loc_fit_shifted, _ = stats.vonmises.fit(shifted_data)
271 assert_allclose(loc_fit, loc_fit_shifted)
272 assert_allclose(kappa_fit, kappa_fit_shifted)
273 assert scale_fit == 1
274 assert -np.pi < loc_fit < np.pi
275
276
277def _assert_less_or_close_loglike(dist, data, func=None, **kwds):
278 """
279 This utility function checks that the negative log-likelihood function
280 (or `func`) of the result computed using dist.fit() is less than or equal
281 to the result computed using the generic fit method. Because of
282 normal numerical imprecision, the "equality" check is made using
283 `np.allclose` with a relative tolerance of 1e-15.
284 """
285 if func is None:
286 func = dist.nnlf
287
288 mle_analytical = dist.fit(data, **kwds)
289 numerical_opt = super(type(dist), dist).fit(data, **kwds)
290 ll_mle_analytical = func(mle_analytical, data)
291 ll_numerical_opt = func(numerical_opt, data)
292 assert (ll_mle_analytical <= ll_numerical_opt or
293 np.allclose(ll_mle_analytical, ll_numerical_opt, rtol=1e-15))
294
295 # Ideally we'd check that shapes are correctly fixed, too, but that is
296 # complicated by the many ways of fixing them (e.g. f0, fix_a, fa).
297 if 'floc' in kwds:
298 assert mle_analytical[-2] == kwds['floc']
299 if 'fscale' in kwds:
300 assert mle_analytical[-1] == kwds['fscale']
301
302
303def assert_fit_warnings(dist):
304 param = ['floc', 'fscale']
305 if dist.shapes:
306 nshapes = len(dist.shapes.split(","))
307 param += ['f0', 'f1', 'f2'][:nshapes]
308 all_fixed = dict(zip(param, np.arange(len(param))))
309 data = [1, 2, 3]
310 with pytest.raises(RuntimeError,
311 match="All parameters fixed. There is nothing "
312 "to optimize."):
313 dist.fit(data, **all_fixed)
314 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
315 match="The data contains non-finite values"):
316 dist.fit([np.nan])
317 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
318 match="The data contains non-finite values"):
319 dist.fit([np.inf])
320 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="Unknown keyword arguments:"):
321 dist.fit(data, extra_keyword=2)
322 with pytest.raises(TypeError, match="Too many positional arguments."):
323 dist.fit(data, *[1]*(len(param) - 1))
324
325
326@pytest.mark.parametrize('dist',
327 ['alpha', 'betaprime',
328 'fatiguelife', 'invgamma', 'invgauss', 'invweibull',
329 'johnsonsb', 'levy', 'levy_l', 'lognorm', 'gibrat',
330 'powerlognorm', 'rayleigh', 'wald'])
331def test_support(dist):
332 """gh-6235"""
333 dct = dict(distcont)
334 args = dct[dist]
335
336 dist = getattr(stats, dist)
337
338 assert_almost_equal(dist.pdf(dist.a, *args), 0)
339 assert_equal(dist.logpdf(dist.a, *args), -np.inf)
340 assert_almost_equal(dist.pdf(dist.b, *args), 0)
341 assert_equal(dist.logpdf(dist.b, *args), -np.inf)
342
343
344class TestRandInt:
345 def setup_method(self):
346 np.random.seed(1234)
347
348 def test_rvs(self):
349 vals = stats.randint.rvs(5, 30, size=100)
350 assert_(numpy.all(vals < 30) & numpy.all(vals >= 5))
351 assert_(len(vals) == 100)
352 vals = stats.randint.rvs(5, 30, size=(2, 50))
353 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
354 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
355 val = stats.randint.rvs(15, 46)
356 assert_((val >= 15) & (val < 46))
357 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ScalarType), msg=repr(type(val)))
358 val = stats.randint(15, 46).rvs(3)
359 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
360
361 def test_pdf(self):
362 k = numpy.r_[0:36]
363 out = numpy.where((k >= 5) & (k < 30), 1.0/(30-5), 0)
364 vals = stats.randint.pmf(k, 5, 30)
365 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, out)
366
367 def test_cdf(self):
368 x = np.linspace(0, 36, 100)
369 k = numpy.floor(x)
370 out = numpy.select([k >= 30, k >= 5], [1.0, (k-5.0+1)/(30-5.0)], 0)
371 vals = stats.randint.cdf(x, 5, 30)
372 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, out, decimal=12)
373
374
375class TestBinom:
376 def setup_method(self):
377 np.random.seed(1234)
378
379 def test_rvs(self):
380 vals = stats.binom.rvs(10, 0.75, size=(2, 50))
381 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 0) & numpy.all(vals <= 10))
382 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
383 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
384 val = stats.binom.rvs(10, 0.75)
385 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
386 val = stats.binom(10, 0.75).rvs(3)
387 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
388 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
389
390 def test_pmf(self):
391 # regression test for Ticket #1842
392 vals1 = stats.binom.pmf(100, 100, 1)
393 vals2 = stats.binom.pmf(0, 100, 0)
394 assert_allclose(vals1, 1.0, rtol=1e-15, atol=0)
395 assert_allclose(vals2, 1.0, rtol=1e-15, atol=0)
396
397 def test_entropy(self):
398 # Basic entropy tests.
399 b = stats.binom(2, 0.5)
400 expected_p = np.array([0.25, 0.5, 0.25])
401 expected_h = -sum(xlogy(expected_p, expected_p))
402 h = b.entropy()
403 assert_allclose(h, expected_h)
404
405 b = stats.binom(2, 0.0)
406 h = b.entropy()
407 assert_equal(h, 0.0)
408
409 b = stats.binom(2, 1.0)
410 h = b.entropy()
411 assert_equal(h, 0.0)
412
413 def test_warns_p0(self):
414 # no spurious warnigns are generated for p=0; gh-3817
415 with warnings.catch_warnings():
416 warnings.simplefilter("error", RuntimeWarning)
417 assert_equal(stats.binom(n=2, p=0).mean(), 0)
418 assert_equal(stats.binom(n=2, p=0).std(), 0)
419
420 def test_ppf_p1(self):
421 # Check that gh-17388 is resolved: PPF == n when p = 1
422 n = 4
423 assert stats.binom.ppf(q=0.3, n=n, p=1.0) == n
424
425 def test_pmf_poisson(self):
426 # Check that gh-17146 is resolved: binom -> poisson
427 n = 1541096362225563.0
428 p = 1.0477878413173978e-18
429 x = np.arange(3)
430 res = stats.binom.pmf(x, n=n, p=p)
431 ref = stats.poisson.pmf(x, n * p)
432 assert_allclose(res, ref, atol=1e-16)
433
434 def test_pmf_cdf(self):
435 # Check that gh-17809 is resolved: binom.pmf(0) ~ binom.cdf(0)
436 n = 25.0 * 10 ** 21
437 p = 1.0 * 10 ** -21
438 r = 0
439 res = stats.binom.pmf(r, n, p)
440 ref = stats.binom.cdf(r, n, p)
441 assert_allclose(res, ref, atol=1e-16)
442
443 def test_pmf_gh15101(self):
444 # Check that gh-15101 is resolved (no divide warnings when p~1, n~oo)
445 res = stats.binom.pmf(3, 2000, 0.999)
446 assert_allclose(res, 0, atol=1e-16)
447
448
449class TestArcsine:
450
451 def test_endpoints(self):
452 # Regression test for gh-13697. The following calculation
453 # should not generate a warning.
454 p = stats.arcsine.pdf([0, 1])
455 assert_equal(p, [np.inf, np.inf])
456
457
458class TestBernoulli:
459 def setup_method(self):
460 np.random.seed(1234)
461
462 def test_rvs(self):
463 vals = stats.bernoulli.rvs(0.75, size=(2, 50))
464 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 0) & numpy.all(vals <= 1))
465 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
466 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
467 val = stats.bernoulli.rvs(0.75)
468 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
469 val = stats.bernoulli(0.75).rvs(3)
470 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
471 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
472
473 def test_entropy(self):
474 # Simple tests of entropy.
475 b = stats.bernoulli(0.25)
476 expected_h = -0.25*np.log(0.25) - 0.75*np.log(0.75)
477 h = b.entropy()
478 assert_allclose(h, expected_h)
479
480 b = stats.bernoulli(0.0)
481 h = b.entropy()
482 assert_equal(h, 0.0)
483
484 b = stats.bernoulli(1.0)
485 h = b.entropy()
486 assert_equal(h, 0.0)
487
488
489class TestBradford:
490 # gh-6216
491 def test_cdf_ppf(self):
492 c = 0.1
493 x = np.logspace(-20, -4)
494 q = stats.bradford.cdf(x, c)
495 xx = stats.bradford.ppf(q, c)
496 assert_allclose(x, xx)
497
498
499class TestChi:
500
501 # "Exact" value of chi.sf(10, 4), as computed by Wolfram Alpha with
502 # 1 - CDF[ChiDistribution[4], 10]
503 CHI_SF_10_4 = 9.83662422461598e-21
504 # "Exact" value of chi.mean(df=1000) as computed by Wolfram Alpha with
505 # Mean[ChiDistribution[1000]]
506 CHI_MEAN_1000 = 31.614871896980
507
508 def test_sf(self):
509 s = stats.chi.sf(10, 4)
510 assert_allclose(s, self.CHI_SF_10_4, rtol=1e-15)
511
512 def test_isf(self):
513 x = stats.chi.isf(self.CHI_SF_10_4, 4)
514 assert_allclose(x, 10, rtol=1e-15)
515
516 def test_mean(self):
517 x = stats.chi.mean(df=1000)
518 assert_allclose(x, self.CHI_MEAN_1000, rtol=1e-12)
519
520 # Entropy references values were computed with the following mpmath code
521 # from mpmath import mp
522 # mp.dps = 50
523 # def chi_entropy_mpmath(df):
524 # df = mp.mpf(df)
525 # half_df = 0.5 * df
526 # entropy = mp.log(mp.gamma(half_df)) + 0.5 * \
527 # (df - mp.log(2) - (df - mp.one) * mp.digamma(half_df))
528 # return float(entropy)
529
530 @pytest.mark.parametrize('df, ref',
531 [(1e-4, -9989.7316027504),
532 (1, 0.7257913526447274),
533 (1e3, 1.0721981095025448),
534 (1e10, 1.0723649429080335),
535 (1e100, 1.0723649429247002)])
536 def test_entropy(self, df, ref):
537 assert_allclose(stats.chi(df).entropy(), ref, rtol=1e-15)
538
539
540class TestNBinom:
541 def setup_method(self):
542 np.random.seed(1234)
543
544 def test_rvs(self):
545 vals = stats.nbinom.rvs(10, 0.75, size=(2, 50))
546 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 0))
547 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
548 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
549 val = stats.nbinom.rvs(10, 0.75)
550 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
551 val = stats.nbinom(10, 0.75).rvs(3)
552 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
553 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
554
555 def test_pmf(self):
556 # regression test for ticket 1779
557 assert_allclose(np.exp(stats.nbinom.logpmf(700, 721, 0.52)),
558 stats.nbinom.pmf(700, 721, 0.52))
559 # logpmf(0,1,1) shouldn't return nan (regression test for gh-4029)
560 val = scipy.stats.nbinom.logpmf(0, 1, 1)
561 assert_equal(val, 0)
562
563 def test_logcdf_gh16159(self):
564 # check that gh16159 is resolved.
565 vals = stats.nbinom.logcdf([0, 5, 0, 5], n=4.8, p=0.45)
566 ref = np.log(stats.nbinom.cdf([0, 5, 0, 5], n=4.8, p=0.45))
567 assert_allclose(vals, ref)
568
569
570class TestGenInvGauss:
571 def setup_method(self):
572 np.random.seed(1234)
573
574 @pytest.mark.slow
575 def test_rvs_with_mode_shift(self):
576 # ratio_unif w/ mode shift
577 gig = stats.geninvgauss(2.3, 1.5)
578 _, p = stats.kstest(gig.rvs(size=1500, random_state=1234), gig.cdf)
579 assert_equal(p > 0.05, True)
580
581 @pytest.mark.slow
582 def test_rvs_without_mode_shift(self):
583 # ratio_unif w/o mode shift
584 gig = stats.geninvgauss(0.9, 0.75)
585 _, p = stats.kstest(gig.rvs(size=1500, random_state=1234), gig.cdf)
586 assert_equal(p > 0.05, True)
587
588 @pytest.mark.slow
589 def test_rvs_new_method(self):
590 # new algorithm of Hoermann / Leydold
591 gig = stats.geninvgauss(0.1, 0.2)
592 _, p = stats.kstest(gig.rvs(size=1500, random_state=1234), gig.cdf)
593 assert_equal(p > 0.05, True)
594
595 @pytest.mark.slow
596 def test_rvs_p_zero(self):
597 def my_ks_check(p, b):
598 gig = stats.geninvgauss(p, b)
599 rvs = gig.rvs(size=1500, random_state=1234)
600 return stats.kstest(rvs, gig.cdf)[1] > 0.05
601 # boundary cases when p = 0
602 assert_equal(my_ks_check(0, 0.2), True) # new algo
603 assert_equal(my_ks_check(0, 0.9), True) # ratio_unif w/o shift
604 assert_equal(my_ks_check(0, 1.5), True) # ratio_unif with shift
605
606 def test_rvs_negative_p(self):
607 # if p negative, return inverse
608 assert_equal(
609 stats.geninvgauss(-1.5, 2).rvs(size=10, random_state=1234),
610 1 / stats.geninvgauss(1.5, 2).rvs(size=10, random_state=1234))
611
612 def test_invgauss(self):
613 # test that invgauss is special case
614 ig = stats.geninvgauss.rvs(size=1500, p=-0.5, b=1, random_state=1234)
615 assert_equal(stats.kstest(ig, 'invgauss', args=[1])[1] > 0.15, True)
616 # test pdf and cdf
617 mu, x = 100, np.linspace(0.01, 1, 10)
618 pdf_ig = stats.geninvgauss.pdf(x, p=-0.5, b=1 / mu, scale=mu)
619 assert_allclose(pdf_ig, stats.invgauss(mu).pdf(x))
620 cdf_ig = stats.geninvgauss.cdf(x, p=-0.5, b=1 / mu, scale=mu)
621 assert_allclose(cdf_ig, stats.invgauss(mu).cdf(x))
622
623 def test_pdf_R(self):
624 # test against R package GIGrvg
625 # x <- seq(0.01, 5, length.out = 10)
626 # GIGrvg::dgig(x, 0.5, 1, 1)
627 vals_R = np.array([2.081176820e-21, 4.488660034e-01, 3.747774338e-01,
628 2.693297528e-01, 1.905637275e-01, 1.351476913e-01,
629 9.636538981e-02, 6.909040154e-02, 4.978006801e-02,
630 3.602084467e-02])
631 x = np.linspace(0.01, 5, 10)
632 assert_allclose(vals_R, stats.geninvgauss.pdf(x, 0.5, 1))
633
634 def test_pdf_zero(self):
635 # pdf at 0 is 0, needs special treatment to avoid 1/x in pdf
636 assert_equal(stats.geninvgauss.pdf(0, 0.5, 0.5), 0)
637 # if x is large and p is moderate, make sure that pdf does not
638 # overflow because of x**(p-1); exp(-b*x) forces pdf to zero
639 assert_equal(stats.geninvgauss.pdf(2e6, 50, 2), 0)
640
641
642class TestGenHyperbolic:
643 def setup_method(self):
644 np.random.seed(1234)
645
646 def test_pdf_r(self):
647 # test against R package GeneralizedHyperbolic
648 # x <- seq(-10, 10, length.out = 10)
649 # GeneralizedHyperbolic::dghyp(
650 # x = x, lambda = 2, alpha = 2, beta = 1, delta = 1.5, mu = 0.5
651 # )
652 vals_R = np.array([
653 2.94895678275316e-13, 1.75746848647696e-10, 9.48149804073045e-08,
654 4.17862521692026e-05, 0.0103947630463822, 0.240864958986839,
655 0.162833527161649, 0.0374609592899472, 0.00634894847327781,
656 0.000941920705790324
657 ])
658
659 lmbda, alpha, beta = 2, 2, 1
660 mu, delta = 0.5, 1.5
661 args = (lmbda, alpha*delta, beta*delta)
662
663 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
664 x = np.linspace(-10, 10, 10)
665
666 assert_allclose(gh.pdf(x), vals_R, atol=0, rtol=1e-13)
667
668 def test_cdf_r(self):
669 # test against R package GeneralizedHyperbolic
670 # q <- seq(-10, 10, length.out = 10)
671 # GeneralizedHyperbolic::pghyp(
672 # q = q, lambda = 2, alpha = 2, beta = 1, delta = 1.5, mu = 0.5
673 # )
674 vals_R = np.array([
675 1.01881590921421e-13, 6.13697274983578e-11, 3.37504977637992e-08,
676 1.55258698166181e-05, 0.00447005453832497, 0.228935323956347,
677 0.755759458895243, 0.953061062884484, 0.992598013917513,
678 0.998942646586662
679 ])
680
681 lmbda, alpha, beta = 2, 2, 1
682 mu, delta = 0.5, 1.5
683 args = (lmbda, alpha*delta, beta*delta)
684
685 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
686 x = np.linspace(-10, 10, 10)
687
688 assert_allclose(gh.cdf(x), vals_R, atol=0, rtol=1e-6)
689
690 # The reference values were computed by implementing the PDF with mpmath
691 # and integrating it with mp.quad. The values were computed with
692 # mp.dps=250, and then again with mp.dps=400 to ensure the full 64 bit
693 # precision was computed.
694 @pytest.mark.parametrize(
695 'x, p, a, b, loc, scale, ref',
696 [(-15, 2, 3, 1.5, 0.5, 1.5, 4.770036428808252e-20),
697 (-15, 10, 1.5, 0.25, 1, 5, 0.03282964575089294),
698 (-15, 10, 1.5, 1.375, 0, 1, 3.3711159600215594e-23),
699 (-15, 0.125, 1.5, 1.49995, 0, 1, 4.729401428898605e-23),
700 (-1, 0.125, 1.5, 1.49995, 0, 1, 0.0003565725914786859),
701 (5, -0.125, 1.5, 1.49995, 0, 1, 0.2600651974023352),
702 (5, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 5.923270556517253e-28),
703 (20, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 0.23452293711665634),
704 (40, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 0.9999648749561968),
705 (60, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 0.9999999999975475)]
706 )
707 def test_cdf_mpmath(self, x, p, a, b, loc, scale, ref):
708 cdf = stats.genhyperbolic.cdf(x, p, a, b, loc=loc, scale=scale)
709 assert_allclose(cdf, ref, rtol=5e-12)
710
711 # The reference values were computed by implementing the PDF with mpmath
712 # and integrating it with mp.quad. The values were computed with
713 # mp.dps=250, and then again with mp.dps=400 to ensure the full 64 bit
714 # precision was computed.
715 @pytest.mark.parametrize(
716 'x, p, a, b, loc, scale, ref',
717 [(0, 1e-6, 12, -1, 0, 1, 0.38520358671350524),
718 (-1, 3, 2.5, 2.375, 1, 3, 0.9999901774267577),
719 (-20, 3, 2.5, 2.375, 1, 3, 1.0),
720 (25, 2, 3, 1.5, 0.5, 1.5, 8.593419916523976e-10),
721 (300, 10, 1.5, 0.25, 1, 5, 6.137415609872158e-24),
722 (60, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 2.4524915075944173e-12),
723 (75, -0.125, 1000, 999, 0, 1, 2.9435194886214633e-18)]
724 )
725 def test_sf_mpmath(self, x, p, a, b, loc, scale, ref):
726 sf = stats.genhyperbolic.sf(x, p, a, b, loc=loc, scale=scale)
727 assert_allclose(sf, ref, rtol=5e-12)
728
729 def test_moments_r(self):
730 # test against R package GeneralizedHyperbolic
731 # sapply(1:4,
732 # function(x) GeneralizedHyperbolic::ghypMom(
733 # order = x, lambda = 2, alpha = 2,
734 # beta = 1, delta = 1.5, mu = 0.5,
735 # momType = 'raw')
736 # )
737
738 vals_R = [2.36848366948115, 8.4739346779246,
739 37.8870502710066, 205.76608511485]
740
741 lmbda, alpha, beta = 2, 2, 1
742 mu, delta = 0.5, 1.5
743 args = (lmbda, alpha*delta, beta*delta)
744
745 vals_us = [
746 stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta).moment(i)
747 for i in range(1, 5)
748 ]
749
750 assert_allclose(vals_us, vals_R, atol=0, rtol=1e-13)
751
752 def test_rvs(self):
753 # Kolmogorov-Smirnov test to ensure alignment
754 # of analytical and empirical cdfs
755
756 lmbda, alpha, beta = 2, 2, 1
757 mu, delta = 0.5, 1.5
758 args = (lmbda, alpha*delta, beta*delta)
759
760 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
761 _, p = stats.kstest(gh.rvs(size=1500, random_state=1234), gh.cdf)
762
763 assert_equal(p > 0.05, True)
764
765 def test_pdf_t(self):
766 # Test Against T-Student with 1 - 30 df
767 df = np.linspace(1, 30, 10)
768
769 # in principle alpha should be zero in practice for big lmbdas
770 # alpha cannot be too small else pdf does not integrate
771 alpha, beta = np.float_power(df, 2)*np.finfo(np.float32).eps, 0
772 mu, delta = 0, np.sqrt(df)
773 args = (-df/2, alpha, beta)
774
775 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
776 x = np.linspace(gh.ppf(0.01), gh.ppf(0.99), 50)[:, np.newaxis]
777
778 assert_allclose(
779 gh.pdf(x), stats.t.pdf(x, df),
780 atol=0, rtol=1e-6
781 )
782
783 def test_pdf_cauchy(self):
784 # Test Against Cauchy distribution
785
786 # in principle alpha should be zero in practice for big lmbdas
787 # alpha cannot be too small else pdf does not integrate
788 lmbda, alpha, beta = -0.5, np.finfo(np.float32).eps, 0
789 mu, delta = 0, 1
790 args = (lmbda, alpha, beta)
791
792 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
793 x = np.linspace(gh.ppf(0.01), gh.ppf(0.99), 50)[:, np.newaxis]
794
795 assert_allclose(
796 gh.pdf(x), stats.cauchy.pdf(x),
797 atol=0, rtol=1e-6
798 )
799
800 def test_pdf_laplace(self):
801 # Test Against Laplace with location param [-10, 10]
802 loc = np.linspace(-10, 10, 10)
803
804 # in principle delta should be zero in practice for big loc delta
805 # cannot be too small else pdf does not integrate
806 delta = np.finfo(np.float32).eps
807
808 lmbda, alpha, beta = 1, 1, 0
809 args = (lmbda, alpha*delta, beta*delta)
810
811 # ppf does not integrate for scale < 5e-4
812 # therefore using simple linspace to define the support
813 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=loc, scale=delta)
814 x = np.linspace(-20, 20, 50)[:, np.newaxis]
815
816 assert_allclose(
817 gh.pdf(x), stats.laplace.pdf(x, loc=loc, scale=1),
818 atol=0, rtol=1e-11
819 )
820
821 def test_pdf_norminvgauss(self):
822 # Test Against NIG with varying alpha/beta/delta/mu
823
824 alpha, beta, delta, mu = (
825 np.linspace(1, 20, 10),
826 np.linspace(0, 19, 10)*np.float_power(-1, range(10)),
827 np.linspace(1, 1, 10),
828 np.linspace(-100, 100, 10)
829 )
830
831 lmbda = - 0.5
832 args = (lmbda, alpha * delta, beta * delta)
833
834 gh = stats.genhyperbolic(*args, loc=mu, scale=delta)
835 x = np.linspace(gh.ppf(0.01), gh.ppf(0.99), 50)[:, np.newaxis]
836
837 assert_allclose(
838 gh.pdf(x), stats.norminvgauss.pdf(
839 x, a=alpha, b=beta, loc=mu, scale=delta),
840 atol=0, rtol=1e-13
841 )
842
843
844class TestNormInvGauss:
845 def setup_method(self):
846 np.random.seed(1234)
847
848 def test_cdf_R(self):
849 # test pdf and cdf vals against R
850 # require("GeneralizedHyperbolic")
851 # x_test <- c(-7, -5, 0, 8, 15)
852 # r_cdf <- GeneralizedHyperbolic::pnig(x_test, mu = 0, a = 1, b = 0.5)
853 # r_pdf <- GeneralizedHyperbolic::dnig(x_test, mu = 0, a = 1, b = 0.5)
854 r_cdf = np.array([8.034920282e-07, 2.512671945e-05, 3.186661051e-01,
855 9.988650664e-01, 9.999848769e-01])
856 x_test = np.array([-7, -5, 0, 8, 15])
857 vals_cdf = stats.norminvgauss.cdf(x_test, a=1, b=0.5)
858 assert_allclose(vals_cdf, r_cdf, atol=1e-9)
859
860 def test_pdf_R(self):
861 # values from R as defined in test_cdf_R
862 r_pdf = np.array([1.359600783e-06, 4.413878805e-05, 4.555014266e-01,
863 7.450485342e-04, 8.917889931e-06])
864 x_test = np.array([-7, -5, 0, 8, 15])
865 vals_pdf = stats.norminvgauss.pdf(x_test, a=1, b=0.5)
866 assert_allclose(vals_pdf, r_pdf, atol=1e-9)
867
868 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, a, b, sf, rtol',
869 [(-1, 1, 0, 0.8759652211005315, 1e-13),
870 (25, 1, 0, 1.1318690184042579e-13, 1e-4),
871 (1, 5, -1.5, 0.002066711134653577, 1e-12),
872 (10, 5, -1.5, 2.308435233930669e-29, 1e-9)])
873 def test_sf_isf_mpmath(self, x, a, b, sf, rtol):
874 # Reference data generated with `reference_distributions.NormInvGauss`,
875 # e.g. `NormInvGauss(alpha=1, beta=0).sf(-1)` with mp.dps = 50
876 s = stats.norminvgauss.sf(x, a, b)
877 assert_allclose(s, sf, rtol=rtol)
878 i = stats.norminvgauss.isf(sf, a, b)
879 assert_allclose(i, x, rtol=rtol)
880
881 def test_sf_isf_mpmath_vectorized(self):
882 x = [-1, 25]
883 a = [1, 1]
884 b = 0
885 sf = [0.8759652211005315, 1.1318690184042579e-13] # see previous test
886 s = stats.norminvgauss.sf(x, a, b)
887 assert_allclose(s, sf, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-16)
888 i = stats.norminvgauss.isf(sf, a, b)
889 # Not perfect, but better than it was. See gh-13338.
890 assert_allclose(i, x, rtol=1e-6)
891
892 def test_gh8718(self):
893 # Add test that gh-13338 resolved gh-8718
894 dst = stats.norminvgauss(1, 0)
895 x = np.arange(0, 20, 2)
896 sf = dst.sf(x)
897 isf = dst.isf(sf)
898 assert_allclose(isf, x)
899
900 def test_stats(self):
901 a, b = 1, 0.5
902 gamma = np.sqrt(a**2 - b**2)
903 v_stats = (b / gamma, a**2 / gamma**3, 3.0 * b / (a * np.sqrt(gamma)),
904 3.0 * (1 + 4 * b**2 / a**2) / gamma)
905 assert_equal(v_stats, stats.norminvgauss.stats(a, b, moments='mvsk'))
906
907 def test_ppf(self):
908 a, b = 1, 0.5
909 x_test = np.array([0.001, 0.5, 0.999])
910 vals = stats.norminvgauss.ppf(x_test, a, b)
911 assert_allclose(x_test, stats.norminvgauss.cdf(vals, a, b))
912
913
914class TestGeom:
915 def setup_method(self):
916 np.random.seed(1234)
917
918 def test_rvs(self):
919 vals = stats.geom.rvs(0.75, size=(2, 50))
920 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 0))
921 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
922 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
923 val = stats.geom.rvs(0.75)
924 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
925 val = stats.geom(0.75).rvs(3)
926 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
927 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
928
929 def test_rvs_9313(self):
930 # previously, RVS were converted to `np.int32` on some platforms,
931 # causing overflow for moderately large integer output (gh-9313).
932 # Check that this is resolved to the extent possible w/ `np.int64`.
933 rng = np.random.default_rng(649496242618848)
934 rvs = stats.geom.rvs(np.exp(-35), size=5, random_state=rng)
935 assert rvs.dtype == np.int64
936 assert np.all(rvs > np.iinfo(np.int32).max)
937
938 def test_pmf(self):
939 vals = stats.geom.pmf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
940 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, [0.5, 0.25, 0.125])
941
942 def test_logpmf(self):
943 # regression test for ticket 1793
944 vals1 = np.log(stats.geom.pmf([1, 2, 3], 0.5))
945 vals2 = stats.geom.logpmf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
946 assert_allclose(vals1, vals2, rtol=1e-15, atol=0)
947
948 # regression test for gh-4028
949 val = stats.geom.logpmf(1, 1)
950 assert_equal(val, 0.0)
951
952 def test_cdf_sf(self):
953 vals = stats.geom.cdf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
954 vals_sf = stats.geom.sf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
955 expected = array([0.5, 0.75, 0.875])
956 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
957 assert_array_almost_equal(vals_sf, 1-expected)
958
959 def test_logcdf_logsf(self):
960 vals = stats.geom.logcdf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
961 vals_sf = stats.geom.logsf([1, 2, 3], 0.5)
962 expected = array([0.5, 0.75, 0.875])
963 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, np.log(expected))
964 assert_array_almost_equal(vals_sf, np.log1p(-expected))
965
966 def test_ppf(self):
967 vals = stats.geom.ppf([0.5, 0.75, 0.875], 0.5)
968 expected = array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0])
969 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
970
971 def test_ppf_underflow(self):
972 # this should not underflow
973 assert_allclose(stats.geom.ppf(1e-20, 1e-20), 1.0, atol=1e-14)
974
975 def test_entropy_gh18226(self):
976 # gh-18226 reported that `geom.entropy` produced a warning and
977 # inaccurate output for small p. Check that this is resolved.
978 h = stats.geom(0.0146).entropy()
979 assert_allclose(h, 5.219397961962308, rtol=1e-15)
980
981
982class TestPlanck:
983 def setup_method(self):
984 np.random.seed(1234)
985
986 def test_sf(self):
987 vals = stats.planck.sf([1, 2, 3], 5.)
988 expected = array([4.5399929762484854e-05,
989 3.0590232050182579e-07,
990 2.0611536224385579e-09])
991 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
992
993 def test_logsf(self):
994 vals = stats.planck.logsf([1000., 2000., 3000.], 1000.)
995 expected = array([-1001000., -2001000., -3001000.])
996 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
997
998
999class TestGennorm:
1000 def test_laplace(self):
1001 # test against Laplace (special case for beta=1)
1002 points = [1, 2, 3]
1003 pdf1 = stats.gennorm.pdf(points, 1)
1004 pdf2 = stats.laplace.pdf(points)
1005 assert_almost_equal(pdf1, pdf2)
1006
1007 def test_norm(self):
1008 # test against normal (special case for beta=2)
1009 points = [1, 2, 3]
1010 pdf1 = stats.gennorm.pdf(points, 2)
1011 pdf2 = stats.norm.pdf(points, scale=2**-.5)
1012 assert_almost_equal(pdf1, pdf2)
1013
1014 def test_rvs(self):
1015 np.random.seed(0)
1016 # 0 < beta < 1
1017 dist = stats.gennorm(0.5)
1018 rvs = dist.rvs(size=1000)
1019 assert stats.kstest(rvs, dist.cdf).pvalue > 0.1
1020 # beta = 1
1021 dist = stats.gennorm(1)
1022 rvs = dist.rvs(size=1000)
1023 rvs_laplace = stats.laplace.rvs(size=1000)
1024 assert stats.ks_2samp(rvs, rvs_laplace).pvalue > 0.1
1025 # beta = 2
1026 dist = stats.gennorm(2)
1027 rvs = dist.rvs(size=1000)
1028 rvs_norm = stats.norm.rvs(scale=1/2**0.5, size=1000)
1029 assert stats.ks_2samp(rvs, rvs_norm).pvalue > 0.1
1030
1031 def test_rvs_broadcasting(self):
1032 np.random.seed(0)
1033 dist = stats.gennorm([[0.5, 1.], [2., 5.]])
1034 rvs = dist.rvs(size=[1000, 2, 2])
1035 assert stats.kstest(rvs[:, 0, 0], stats.gennorm(0.5).cdf)[1] > 0.1
1036 assert stats.kstest(rvs[:, 0, 1], stats.gennorm(1.0).cdf)[1] > 0.1
1037 assert stats.kstest(rvs[:, 1, 0], stats.gennorm(2.0).cdf)[1] > 0.1
1038 assert stats.kstest(rvs[:, 1, 1], stats.gennorm(5.0).cdf)[1] > 0.1
1039
1040
1041class TestGibrat:
1042
1043 # sfx is sf(x). The values were computed with mpmath:
1044 #
1045 # from mpmath import mp
1046 # mp.dps = 100
1047 # def gibrat_sf(x):
1048 # return 1 - mp.ncdf(mp.log(x))
1049 #
1050 # E.g.
1051 #
1052 # >>> float(gibrat_sf(1.5))
1053 # 0.3425678305148459
1054 #
1055 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, sfx', [(1.5, 0.3425678305148459),
1056 (5000, 8.173334352522493e-18)])
1057 def test_sf_isf(self, x, sfx):
1058 assert_allclose(stats.gibrat.sf(x), sfx, rtol=2e-14)
1059 assert_allclose(stats.gibrat.isf(sfx), x, rtol=2e-14)
1060
1061
1062class TestGompertz:
1063
1064 def test_gompertz_accuracy(self):
1065 # Regression test for gh-4031
1066 p = stats.gompertz.ppf(stats.gompertz.cdf(1e-100, 1), 1)
1067 assert_allclose(p, 1e-100)
1068
1069 # sfx is sf(x). The values were computed with mpmath:
1070 #
1071 # from mpmath import mp
1072 # mp.dps = 100
1073 # def gompertz_sf(x, c):
1074 # reurn mp.exp(-c*mp.expm1(x))
1075 #
1076 # E.g.
1077 #
1078 # >>> float(gompertz_sf(1, 2.5))
1079 # 0.013626967146253437
1080 #
1081 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, sfx', [(1, 2.5, 0.013626967146253437),
1082 (3, 2.5, 1.8973243273704087e-21),
1083 (0.05, 5, 0.7738668242570479),
1084 (2.25, 5, 3.707795833465481e-19)])
1085 def test_sf_isf(self, x, c, sfx):
1086 assert_allclose(stats.gompertz.sf(x, c), sfx, rtol=1e-14)
1087 assert_allclose(stats.gompertz.isf(sfx, c), x, rtol=1e-14)
1088
1089 # reference values were computed with mpmath
1090 # from mpmath import mp
1091 # mp.dps = 100
1092 # def gompertz_entropy(c):
1093 # c = mp.mpf(c)
1094 # return float(mp.one - mp.log(c) - mp.exp(c)*mp.e1(c))
1095
1096 @pytest.mark.parametrize('c, ref', [(1e-4, 1.5762523017634573),
1097 (1, 0.4036526376768059),
1098 (1000, -5.908754280976161),
1099 (1e10, -22.025850930040455)])
1100 def test_entropy(self, c, ref):
1101 assert_allclose(stats.gompertz.entropy(c), ref, rtol=1e-14)
1102
1103
1104class TestFoldNorm:
1105
1106 # reference values were computed with mpmath with 50 digits of precision
1107 # from mpmath import mp
1108 # mp.dps = 50
1109 # mp.mpf(0.5) * (mp.erf((x - c)/mp.sqrt(2)) + mp.erf((x + c)/mp.sqrt(2)))
1110
1111 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, ref', [(1e-4, 1e-8, 7.978845594730578e-05),
1112 (1e-4, 1e-4, 7.97884555483635e-05)])
1113 def test_cdf(self, x, c, ref):
1114 assert_allclose(stats.foldnorm.cdf(x, c), ref, rtol=1e-15)
1115
1116
1117class TestHalfNorm:
1118
1119 # sfx is sf(x). The values were computed with mpmath:
1120 #
1121 # from mpmath import mp
1122 # mp.dps = 100
1123 # def halfnorm_sf(x):
1124 # reurn 2*(1 - mp.ncdf(x))
1125 #
1126 # E.g.
1127 #
1128 # >>> float(halfnorm_sf(1))
1129 # 0.3173105078629141
1130 #
1131 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, sfx', [(1, 0.3173105078629141),
1132 (10, 1.523970604832105e-23)])
1133 def test_sf_isf(self, x, sfx):
1134 assert_allclose(stats.halfnorm.sf(x), sfx, rtol=1e-14)
1135 assert_allclose(stats.halfnorm.isf(sfx), x, rtol=1e-14)
1136
1137 # reference values were computed via mpmath
1138 # from mpmath import mp
1139 # mp.dps = 100
1140 # def halfnorm_cdf_mpmath(x):
1141 # x = mp.mpf(x)
1142 # return float(mp.erf(x/mp.sqrt(2.)))
1143
1144 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, ref', [(1e-40, 7.978845608028653e-41),
1145 (1e-18, 7.978845608028654e-19),
1146 (8, 0.9999999999999988)])
1147 def test_cdf(self, x, ref):
1148 assert_allclose(stats.halfnorm.cdf(x), ref, rtol=1e-15)
1149
1150
1151class TestHalfLogistic:
1152 # survival function reference values were computed with mpmath
1153 # from mpmath import mp
1154 # mp.dps = 50
1155 # def sf_mpmath(x):
1156 # x = mp.mpf(x)
1157 # return float(mp.mpf(2.)/(mp.exp(x) + mp.one))
1158
1159 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, ref', [(100, 7.440151952041672e-44),
1160 (200, 2.767793053473475e-87)])
1161 def test_sf(self, x, ref):
1162 assert_allclose(stats.halflogistic.sf(x), ref, rtol=1e-15)
1163
1164 # inverse survival function reference values were computed with mpmath
1165 # from mpmath import mp
1166 # mp.dps = 200
1167 # def isf_mpmath(x):
1168 # halfx = mp.mpf(x)/2
1169 # return float(-mp.log(halfx/(mp.one - halfx)))
1170
1171 @pytest.mark.parametrize('q, ref', [(7.440151952041672e-44, 100),
1172 (2.767793053473475e-87, 200),
1173 (1-1e-9, 1.999999943436137e-09),
1174 (1-1e-15, 1.9984014443252818e-15)])
1175 def test_isf(self, q, ref):
1176 assert_allclose(stats.halflogistic.isf(q), ref, rtol=1e-15)
1177
1178
1179class TestHalfgennorm:
1180 def test_expon(self):
1181 # test against exponential (special case for beta=1)
1182 points = [1, 2, 3]
1183 pdf1 = stats.halfgennorm.pdf(points, 1)
1184 pdf2 = stats.expon.pdf(points)
1185 assert_almost_equal(pdf1, pdf2)
1186
1187 def test_halfnorm(self):
1188 # test against half normal (special case for beta=2)
1189 points = [1, 2, 3]
1190 pdf1 = stats.halfgennorm.pdf(points, 2)
1191 pdf2 = stats.halfnorm.pdf(points, scale=2**-.5)
1192 assert_almost_equal(pdf1, pdf2)
1193
1194 def test_gennorm(self):
1195 # test against generalized normal
1196 points = [1, 2, 3]
1197 pdf1 = stats.halfgennorm.pdf(points, .497324)
1198 pdf2 = stats.gennorm.pdf(points, .497324)
1199 assert_almost_equal(pdf1, 2*pdf2)
1200
1201
1202class TestLaplaceasymmetric:
1203 def test_laplace(self):
1204 # test against Laplace (special case for kappa=1)
1205 points = np.array([1, 2, 3])
1206 pdf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.pdf(points, 1)
1207 pdf2 = stats.laplace.pdf(points)
1208 assert_allclose(pdf1, pdf2)
1209
1210 def test_asymmetric_laplace_pdf(self):
1211 # test assymetric Laplace
1212 points = np.array([1, 2, 3])
1213 kappa = 2
1214 kapinv = 1/kappa
1215 pdf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.pdf(points, kappa)
1216 pdf2 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.pdf(points*(kappa**2), kapinv)
1217 assert_allclose(pdf1, pdf2)
1218
1219 def test_asymmetric_laplace_log_10_16(self):
1220 # test assymetric Laplace
1221 points = np.array([-np.log(16), np.log(10)])
1222 kappa = 2
1223 pdf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.pdf(points, kappa)
1224 cdf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.cdf(points, kappa)
1225 sf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.sf(points, kappa)
1226 pdf2 = np.array([1/10, 1/250])
1227 cdf2 = np.array([1/5, 1 - 1/500])
1228 sf2 = np.array([4/5, 1/500])
1229 ppf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.ppf(cdf2, kappa)
1230 ppf2 = points
1231 isf1 = stats.laplace_asymmetric.isf(sf2, kappa)
1232 isf2 = points
1233 assert_allclose(np.concatenate((pdf1, cdf1, sf1, ppf1, isf1)),
1234 np.concatenate((pdf2, cdf2, sf2, ppf2, isf2)))
1235
1236
1237class TestTruncnorm:
1238 def setup_method(self):
1239 np.random.seed(1234)
1240
1241 @pytest.mark.parametrize("a, b, ref",
1242 [(0, 100, 0.7257913526447274),
1243 (0.6, 0.7, -2.3027610681852573),
1244 (1e-06, 2e-06, -13.815510557964274)])
1245 def test_entropy(self, a, b, ref):
1246 # All reference values were calculated with mpmath:
1247 # import numpy as np
1248 # from mpmath import mp
1249 # mp.dps = 50
1250 # def entropy_trun(a, b):
1251 # a, b = mp.mpf(a), mp.mpf(b)
1252 # Z = mp.ncdf(b) - mp.ncdf(a)
1253 #
1254 # def pdf(x):
1255 # return mp.npdf(x) / Z
1256 #
1257 # res = -mp.quad(lambda t: pdf(t) * mp.log(pdf(t)), [a, b])
1258 # return np.float64(res)
1259 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm.entropy(a, b), ref, rtol=1e-10)
1260
1261 @pytest.mark.parametrize("a, b, ref",
1262 [(1e-11, 10000000000.0, 0.725791352640738),
1263 (1e-100, 1e+100, 0.7257913526447274),
1264 (-1e-100, 1e+100, 0.7257913526447274),
1265 (-1e+100, 1e+100, 1.4189385332046727)])
1266 def test_extreme_entropy(self, a, b, ref):
1267 # The reference values were calculated with mpmath
1268 # import numpy as np
1269 # from mpmath import mp
1270 # mp.dps = 50
1271 # def trunc_norm_entropy(a, b):
1272 # a, b = mp.mpf(a), mp.mpf(b)
1273 # Z = mp.ncdf(b) - mp.ncdf(a)
1274 # A = mp.log(mp.sqrt(2 * mp.pi * mp.e) * Z)
1275 # B = (a * mp.npdf(a) - b * mp.npdf(b)) / (2 * Z)
1276 # return np.float64(A + B)
1277 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm.entropy(a, b), ref, rtol=1e-14)
1278
1279 def test_ppf_ticket1131(self):
1280 vals = stats.truncnorm.ppf([-0.5, 0, 1e-4, 0.5, 1-1e-4, 1, 2], -1., 1.,
1281 loc=[3]*7, scale=2)
1282 expected = np.array([np.nan, 1, 1.00056419, 3, 4.99943581, 5, np.nan])
1283 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
1284
1285 def test_isf_ticket1131(self):
1286 vals = stats.truncnorm.isf([-0.5, 0, 1e-4, 0.5, 1-1e-4, 1, 2], -1., 1.,
1287 loc=[3]*7, scale=2)
1288 expected = np.array([np.nan, 5, 4.99943581, 3, 1.00056419, 1, np.nan])
1289 assert_array_almost_equal(vals, expected)
1290
1291 def test_gh_2477_small_values(self):
1292 # Check a case that worked in the original issue.
1293 low, high = -11, -10
1294 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1295 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1296 # Check a case that failed in the original issue.
1297 low, high = 10, 11
1298 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1299 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1300
1301 def test_gh_2477_large_values(self):
1302 # Check a case that used to fail because of extreme tailness.
1303 low, high = 100, 101
1304 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1305 assert_(low <= x.min() <= x.max() <= high), str([low, high, x])
1306
1307 # Check some additional extreme tails
1308 low, high = 1000, 1001
1309 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1310 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1311
1312 low, high = 10000, 10001
1313 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1314 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1315
1316 low, high = -10001, -10000
1317 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1318 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1319
1320 def test_gh_9403_nontail_values(self):
1321 for low, high in [[3, 4], [-4, -3]]:
1322 xvals = np.array([-np.inf, low, high, np.inf])
1323 xmid = (high+low)/2.0
1324 cdfs = stats.truncnorm.cdf(xvals, low, high)
1325 sfs = stats.truncnorm.sf(xvals, low, high)
1326 pdfs = stats.truncnorm.pdf(xvals, low, high)
1327 expected_cdfs = np.array([0, 0, 1, 1])
1328 expected_sfs = np.array([1.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0])
1329 expected_pdfs = np.array([0, 3.3619772, 0.1015229, 0])
1330 if low < 0:
1331 expected_pdfs = np.array([0, 0.1015229, 3.3619772, 0])
1332 assert_almost_equal(cdfs, expected_cdfs)
1333 assert_almost_equal(sfs, expected_sfs)
1334 assert_almost_equal(pdfs, expected_pdfs)
1335 assert_almost_equal(np.log(expected_pdfs[1]/expected_pdfs[2]),
1336 low + 0.5)
1337 pvals = np.array([0, 0.5, 1.0])
1338 ppfs = stats.truncnorm.ppf(pvals, low, high)
1339 expected_ppfs = np.array([low, np.sign(low)*3.1984741, high])
1340 assert_almost_equal(ppfs, expected_ppfs)
1341
1342 if low < 0:
1343 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.sf(xmid, low, high),
1344 0.8475544278436675)
1345 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.cdf(xmid, low, high),
1346 0.1524455721563326)
1347 else:
1348 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.cdf(xmid, low, high),
1349 0.8475544278436675)
1350 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.sf(xmid, low, high),
1351 0.1524455721563326)
1352 pdf = stats.truncnorm.pdf(xmid, low, high)
1353 assert_almost_equal(np.log(pdf/expected_pdfs[2]), (xmid+0.25)/2)
1354
1355 def test_gh_9403_medium_tail_values(self):
1356 for low, high in [[39, 40], [-40, -39]]:
1357 xvals = np.array([-np.inf, low, high, np.inf])
1358 xmid = (high+low)/2.0
1359 cdfs = stats.truncnorm.cdf(xvals, low, high)
1360 sfs = stats.truncnorm.sf(xvals, low, high)
1361 pdfs = stats.truncnorm.pdf(xvals, low, high)
1362 expected_cdfs = np.array([0, 0, 1, 1])
1363 expected_sfs = np.array([1.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0])
1364 expected_pdfs = np.array([0, 3.90256074e+01, 2.73349092e-16, 0])
1365 if low < 0:
1366 expected_pdfs = np.array([0, 2.73349092e-16,
1367 3.90256074e+01, 0])
1368 assert_almost_equal(cdfs, expected_cdfs)
1369 assert_almost_equal(sfs, expected_sfs)
1370 assert_almost_equal(pdfs, expected_pdfs)
1371 assert_almost_equal(np.log(expected_pdfs[1]/expected_pdfs[2]),
1372 low + 0.5)
1373 pvals = np.array([0, 0.5, 1.0])
1374 ppfs = stats.truncnorm.ppf(pvals, low, high)
1375 expected_ppfs = np.array([low, np.sign(low)*39.01775731, high])
1376 assert_almost_equal(ppfs, expected_ppfs)
1377 cdfs = stats.truncnorm.cdf(ppfs, low, high)
1378 assert_almost_equal(cdfs, pvals)
1379
1380 if low < 0:
1381 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.sf(xmid, low, high),
1382 0.9999999970389126)
1383 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.cdf(xmid, low, high),
1384 2.961048103554866e-09)
1385 else:
1386 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.cdf(xmid, low, high),
1387 0.9999999970389126)
1388 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.sf(xmid, low, high),
1389 2.961048103554866e-09)
1390 pdf = stats.truncnorm.pdf(xmid, low, high)
1391 assert_almost_equal(np.log(pdf/expected_pdfs[2]), (xmid+0.25)/2)
1392
1393 xvals = np.linspace(low, high, 11)
1394 xvals2 = -xvals[::-1]
1395 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.cdf(xvals, low, high),
1396 stats.truncnorm.sf(xvals2, -high, -low)[::-1])
1397 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.sf(xvals, low, high),
1398 stats.truncnorm.cdf(xvals2, -high, -low)[::-1])
1399 assert_almost_equal(stats.truncnorm.pdf(xvals, low, high),
1400 stats.truncnorm.pdf(xvals2, -high, -low)[::-1])
1401
1402 def test_cdf_tail_15110_14753(self):
1403 # Check accuracy issues reported in gh-14753 and gh-155110
1404 # Ground truth values calculated using Wolfram Alpha, e.g.
1405 # (CDF[NormalDistribution[0,1],83/10]-CDF[NormalDistribution[0,1],8])/
1406 # (1 - CDF[NormalDistribution[0,1],8])
1407 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm(13., 15.).cdf(14.),
1408 0.9999987259565643)
1409 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm(8, np.inf).cdf(8.3),
1410 0.9163220907327540)
1411
1412 # Test data for the truncnorm stats() method.
1413 # The data in each row is:
1414 # a, b, mean, variance, skewness, excess kurtosis. Generated using
1415 # https://gist.github.com/WarrenWeckesser/636b537ee889679227d53543d333a720
1416 _truncnorm_stats_data = [
1417 [-30, 30,
1418 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0],
1419 [-10, 10,
1420 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, -1.4927521335810455e-19],
1421 [-3, 3,
1422 0.0, 0.9733369246625415, 0.0, -0.17111443639774404],
1423 [-2, 2,
1424 0.0, 0.7737413035499232, 0.0, -0.6344632828703505],
1425 [0, np.inf,
1426 0.7978845608028654,
1427 0.3633802276324187,
1428 0.995271746431156,
1429 0.8691773036059741],
1430 [-np.inf, 0,
1431 -0.7978845608028654,
1432 0.3633802276324187,
1433 -0.995271746431156,
1434 0.8691773036059741],
1435 [-1, 3,
1436 0.282786110727154,
1437 0.6161417353578293,
1438 0.5393018494027877,
1439 -0.20582065135274694],
1440 [-3, 1,
1441 -0.282786110727154,
1442 0.6161417353578293,
1443 -0.5393018494027877,
1444 -0.20582065135274694],
1445 [-10, -9,
1446 -9.108456288012409,
1447 0.011448805821636248,
1448 -1.8985607290949496,
1449 5.0733461105025075],
1450 ]
1451 _truncnorm_stats_data = np.array(_truncnorm_stats_data)
1452
1453 @pytest.mark.parametrize("case", _truncnorm_stats_data)
1454 def test_moments(self, case):
1455 a, b, m0, v0, s0, k0 = case
1456 m, v, s, k = stats.truncnorm.stats(a, b, moments='mvsk')
1457 assert_allclose([m, v, s, k], [m0, v0, s0, k0], atol=1e-17)
1458
1459 def test_9902_moments(self):
1460 m, v = stats.truncnorm.stats(0, np.inf, moments='mv')
1461 assert_almost_equal(m, 0.79788456)
1462 assert_almost_equal(v, 0.36338023)
1463
1464 def test_gh_1489_trac_962_rvs(self):
1465 # Check the original example.
1466 low, high = 10, 15
1467 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, 0, 1, size=10)
1468 assert_(low < x.min() < x.max() < high)
1469
1470 def test_gh_11299_rvs(self):
1471 # Arose from investigating gh-11299
1472 # Test multiple shape parameters simultaneously.
1473 low = [-10, 10, -np.inf, -5, -np.inf, -np.inf, -45, -45, 40, -10, 40]
1474 high = [-5, 11, 5, np.inf, 40, -40, 40, -40, 45, np.inf, np.inf]
1475 x = stats.truncnorm.rvs(low, high, size=(5, len(low)))
1476 assert np.shape(x) == (5, len(low))
1477 assert_(np.all(low <= x.min(axis=0)))
1478 assert_(np.all(x.max(axis=0) <= high))
1479
1480 def test_rvs_Generator(self):
1481 # check that rvs can use a Generator
1482 if hasattr(np.random, "default_rng"):
1483 stats.truncnorm.rvs(-10, -5, size=5,
1484 random_state=np.random.default_rng())
1485
1486 def test_logcdf_gh17064(self):
1487 # regression test for gh-17064 - avoid roundoff error for logcdfs ~0
1488 a = np.array([-np.inf, -np.inf, -8, -np.inf, 10])
1489 b = np.array([np.inf, np.inf, 8, 10, np.inf])
1490 x = np.array([10, 7.5, 7.5, 9, 20])
1491 expected = [-7.619853024160525e-24, -3.190891672910947e-14,
1492 -3.128682067168231e-14, -1.1285122074235991e-19,
1493 -3.61374964828753e-66]
1494 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm(a, b).logcdf(x), expected)
1495 assert_allclose(stats.truncnorm(-b, -a).logsf(-x), expected)
1496
1497 def test_moments_gh18634(self):
1498 # gh-18634 reported that moments 5 and higher didn't work; check that
1499 # this is resolved
1500 res = stats.truncnorm(-2, 3).moment(5)
1501 # From Mathematica:
1502 # Moment[TruncatedDistribution[{-2, 3}, NormalDistribution[]], 5]
1503 ref = 1.645309620208361
1504 assert_allclose(res, ref)
1505
1506
1507class TestGenLogistic:
1508
1509 # Expected values computed with mpmath with 50 digits of precision.
1510 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, expected', [(-1000, -1499.5945348918917),
1511 (-125, -187.09453489189184),
1512 (0, -1.3274028432916989),
1513 (100, -99.59453489189184),
1514 (1000, -999.5945348918918)])
1515 def test_logpdf(self, x, expected):
1516 c = 1.5
1517 logp = stats.genlogistic.logpdf(x, c)
1518 assert_allclose(logp, expected, rtol=1e-13)
1519
1520 # Expected values computed with mpmath with 50 digits of precision
1521 # from mpmath import mp
1522 # mp.dps = 50
1523 # def entropy_mp(c):
1524 # c = mp.mpf(c)
1525 # return float(-mp.log(c)+mp.one+mp.digamma(c + mp.one) + mp.euler)
1526
1527 @pytest.mark.parametrize('c, ref', [(1e-100, 231.25850929940458),
1528 (1e-4, 10.21050485336338),
1529 (1e8, 1.577215669901533),
1530 (1e100, 1.5772156649015328)])
1531 def test_entropy(self, c, ref):
1532 assert_allclose(stats.genlogistic.entropy(c), ref, rtol=5e-15)
1533
1534 # Expected values computed with mpmath with 50 digits of precision
1535 # from mpmath import mp
1536 # mp.dps = 1000
1537 #
1538 # def genlogistic_cdf_mp(x, c):
1539 # x = mp.mpf(x)
1540 # c = mp.mpf(c)
1541 # return (mp.one + mp.exp(-x)) ** (-c)
1542 #
1543 # def genlogistic_sf_mp(x, c):
1544 # return mp.one - genlogistic_cdf_mp(x, c)
1545 #
1546 # x, c, ref = 100, 0.02, -7.440151952041672e-466
1547 # print(float(mp.log(genlogistic_cdf_mp(x, c))))
1548 # ppf/isf reference values generated by passing in `ref` (`q` is produced)
1549
1550 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, ref', [(200, 10, 1.3838965267367375e-86),
1551 (500, 20, 1.424915281348257e-216)])
1552 def test_sf(self, x, c, ref):
1553 assert_allclose(stats.genlogistic.sf(x, c), ref, rtol=1e-14)
1554
1555 @pytest.mark.parametrize('q, c, ref', [(0.01, 200, 9.898441467379765),
1556 (0.001, 2, 7.600152115573173)])
1557 def test_isf(self, q, c, ref):
1558 assert_allclose(stats.genlogistic.isf(q, c), ref, rtol=5e-16)
1559
1560 @pytest.mark.parametrize('q, c, ref', [(0.5, 200, 5.6630969187064615),
1561 (0.99, 20, 7.595630231412436)])
1562 def test_ppf(self, q, c, ref):
1563 assert_allclose(stats.genlogistic.ppf(q, c), ref, rtol=5e-16)
1564
1565 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, ref', [(100, 0.02, -7.440151952041672e-46),
1566 (50, 20, -3.857499695927835e-21)])
1567 def test_logcdf(self, x, c, ref):
1568 assert_allclose(stats.genlogistic.logcdf(x, c), ref, rtol=1e-15)
1569
1570
1571class TestHypergeom:
1572 def setup_method(self):
1573 np.random.seed(1234)
1574
1575 def test_rvs(self):
1576 vals = stats.hypergeom.rvs(20, 10, 3, size=(2, 50))
1577 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 0) &
1578 numpy.all(vals <= 3))
1579 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
1580 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
1581 val = stats.hypergeom.rvs(20, 3, 10)
1582 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
1583 val = stats.hypergeom(20, 3, 10).rvs(3)
1584 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
1585 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
1586
1587 def test_precision(self):
1588 # comparison number from mpmath
1589 M = 2500
1590 n = 50
1591 N = 500
1592 tot = M
1593 good = n
1594 hgpmf = stats.hypergeom.pmf(2, tot, good, N)
1595 assert_almost_equal(hgpmf, 0.0010114963068932233, 11)
1596
1597 def test_args(self):
1598 # test correct output for corner cases of arguments
1599 # see gh-2325
1600 assert_almost_equal(stats.hypergeom.pmf(0, 2, 1, 0), 1.0, 11)
1601 assert_almost_equal(stats.hypergeom.pmf(1, 2, 1, 0), 0.0, 11)
1602
1603 assert_almost_equal(stats.hypergeom.pmf(0, 2, 0, 2), 1.0, 11)
1604 assert_almost_equal(stats.hypergeom.pmf(1, 2, 1, 0), 0.0, 11)
1605
1606 def test_cdf_above_one(self):
1607 # for some values of parameters, hypergeom cdf was >1, see gh-2238
1608 assert_(0 <= stats.hypergeom.cdf(30, 13397950, 4363, 12390) <= 1.0)
1609
1610 def test_precision2(self):
1611 # Test hypergeom precision for large numbers. See #1218.
1612 # Results compared with those from R.
1613 oranges = 9.9e4
1614 pears = 1.1e5
1615 fruits_eaten = np.array([3, 3.8, 3.9, 4, 4.1, 4.2, 5]) * 1e4
1616 quantile = 2e4
1617 res = [stats.hypergeom.sf(quantile, oranges + pears, oranges, eaten)
1618 for eaten in fruits_eaten]
1619 expected = np.array([0, 1.904153e-114, 2.752693e-66, 4.931217e-32,
1620 8.265601e-11, 0.1237904, 1])
1621 assert_allclose(res, expected, atol=0, rtol=5e-7)
1622
1623 # Test with array_like first argument
1624 quantiles = [1.9e4, 2e4, 2.1e4, 2.15e4]
1625 res2 = stats.hypergeom.sf(quantiles, oranges + pears, oranges, 4.2e4)
1626 expected2 = [1, 0.1237904, 6.511452e-34, 3.277667e-69]
1627 assert_allclose(res2, expected2, atol=0, rtol=5e-7)
1628
1629 def test_entropy(self):
1630 # Simple tests of entropy.
1631 hg = stats.hypergeom(4, 1, 1)
1632 h = hg.entropy()
1633 expected_p = np.array([0.75, 0.25])
1634 expected_h = -np.sum(xlogy(expected_p, expected_p))
1635 assert_allclose(h, expected_h)
1636
1637 hg = stats.hypergeom(1, 1, 1)
1638 h = hg.entropy()
1639 assert_equal(h, 0.0)
1640
1641 def test_logsf(self):
1642 # Test logsf for very large numbers. See issue #4982
1643 # Results compare with those from R (v3.2.0):
1644 # phyper(k, n, M-n, N, lower.tail=FALSE, log.p=TRUE)
1645 # -2239.771
1646
1647 k = 1e4
1648 M = 1e7
1649 n = 1e6
1650 N = 5e4
1651
1652 result = stats.hypergeom.logsf(k, M, n, N)
1653 expected = -2239.771 # From R
1654 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=3)
1655
1656 k = 1
1657 M = 1600
1658 n = 600
1659 N = 300
1660
1661 result = stats.hypergeom.logsf(k, M, n, N)
1662 expected = -2.566567e-68 # From R
1663 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=15)
1664
1665 def test_logcdf(self):
1666 # Test logcdf for very large numbers. See issue #8692
1667 # Results compare with those from R (v3.3.2):
1668 # phyper(k, n, M-n, N, lower.tail=TRUE, log.p=TRUE)
1669 # -5273.335
1670
1671 k = 1
1672 M = 1e7
1673 n = 1e6
1674 N = 5e4
1675
1676 result = stats.hypergeom.logcdf(k, M, n, N)
1677 expected = -5273.335 # From R
1678 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=3)
1679
1680 # Same example as in issue #8692
1681 k = 40
1682 M = 1600
1683 n = 50
1684 N = 300
1685
1686 result = stats.hypergeom.logcdf(k, M, n, N)
1687 expected = -7.565148879229e-23 # From R
1688 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=15)
1689
1690 k = 125
1691 M = 1600
1692 n = 250
1693 N = 500
1694
1695 result = stats.hypergeom.logcdf(k, M, n, N)
1696 expected = -4.242688e-12 # From R
1697 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=15)
1698
1699 # test broadcasting robustness based on reviewer
1700 # concerns in PR 9603; using an array version of
1701 # the example from issue #8692
1702 k = np.array([40, 40, 40])
1703 M = 1600
1704 n = 50
1705 N = 300
1706
1707 result = stats.hypergeom.logcdf(k, M, n, N)
1708 expected = np.full(3, -7.565148879229e-23) # filled from R result
1709 assert_almost_equal(result, expected, decimal=15)
1710
1711
1712class TestLoggamma:
1713
1714 # Expected cdf values were computed with mpmath. For given x and c,
1715 # x = mpmath.mpf(x)
1716 # c = mpmath.mpf(c)
1717 # cdf = mpmath.gammainc(c, 0, mpmath.exp(x),
1718 # regularized=True)
1719 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, cdf',
1720 [(1, 2, 0.7546378854206702),
1721 (-1, 14, 6.768116452566383e-18),
1722 (-745.1, 0.001, 0.4749605142005238),
1723 (-800, 0.001, 0.44958802911019136),
1724 (-725, 0.1, 3.4301205868273265e-32),
1725 (-740, 0.75, 1.0074360436599631e-241)])
1726 def test_cdf_ppf(self, x, c, cdf):
1727 p = stats.loggamma.cdf(x, c)
1728 assert_allclose(p, cdf, rtol=1e-13)
1729 y = stats.loggamma.ppf(cdf, c)
1730 assert_allclose(y, x, rtol=1e-13)
1731
1732 # Expected sf values were computed with mpmath. For given x and c,
1733 # x = mpmath.mpf(x)
1734 # c = mpmath.mpf(c)
1735 # sf = mpmath.gammainc(c, mpmath.exp(x), mpmath.inf,
1736 # regularized=True)
1737 @pytest.mark.parametrize('x, c, sf',
1738 [(4, 1.5, 1.6341528919488565e-23),
1739 (6, 100, 8.23836829202024e-74),
1740 (-800, 0.001, 0.5504119708898086),
1741 (-743, 0.0025, 0.8437131370024089)])
1742 def test_sf_isf(self, x, c, sf):
1743 s = stats.loggamma.sf(x, c)
1744 assert_allclose(s, sf, rtol=1e-13)
1745 y = stats.loggamma.isf(sf, c)
1746 assert_allclose(y, x, rtol=1e-13)
1747
1748 def test_logpdf(self):
1749 # Test logpdf with x=-500, c=2. ln(gamma(2)) = 0, and
1750 # exp(-500) ~= 7e-218, which is far smaller than the ULP
1751 # of c*x=-1000, so logpdf(-500, 2) = c*x - exp(x) - ln(gamma(2))
1752 # should give -1000.0.
1753 lp = stats.loggamma.logpdf(-500, 2)
1754 assert_allclose(lp, -1000.0, rtol=1e-14)
1755
1756 def test_stats(self):
1757 # The following precomputed values are from the table in section 2.2
1758 # of "A Statistical Study of Log-Gamma Distribution", by Ping Shing
1759 # Chan (thesis, McMaster University, 1993).
1760 table = np.array([
1761 # c, mean, var, skew, exc. kurt.
1762 0.5, -1.9635, 4.9348, -1.5351, 4.0000,
1763 1.0, -0.5772, 1.6449, -1.1395, 2.4000,
1764 12.0, 2.4427, 0.0869, -0.2946, 0.1735,
1765 ]).reshape(-1, 5)
1766 for c, mean, var, skew, kurt in table:
1767 computed = stats.loggamma.stats(c, moments='msvk')
1768 assert_array_almost_equal(computed, [mean, var, skew, kurt],
1769 decimal=4)
1770
1771 @pytest.mark.parametrize('c', [0.1, 0.001])
1772 def test_rvs(self, c):
1773 # Regression test for gh-11094.
1774 x = stats.loggamma.rvs(c, size=100000)
1775 # Before gh-11094 was fixed, the case with c=0.001 would
1776 # generate many -inf values.
1777 assert np.isfinite(x).all()
1778 # Crude statistical test. About half the values should be
1779 # less than the median and half greater than the median.
1780 med = stats.loggamma.median(c)
1781 btest = stats.binomtest(np.count_nonzero(x < med), len(x))
1782 ci = btest.proportion_ci(confidence_level=0.999)
1783 assert ci.low < 0.5 < ci.high
1784
1785
1786class TestJohnsonsu:
1787 # reference values were computed via mpmath
1788 # from mpmath import mp
1789 # mp.dps = 50
1790 # def johnsonsu_sf(x, a, b):
1791 # x = mp.mpf(x)
1792 # a = mp.mpf(a)
1793 # b = mp.mpf(b)
1794 # return float(mp.ncdf(-(a + b * mp.log(x + mp.sqrt(x*x + 1)))))
1795 # Order is x, a, b, sf, isf tol
1796 # (Can't expect full precision when the ISF input is very nearly 1)
1797 cases = [(-500, 1, 1, 0.9999999982660072, 1e-8),
1798 (2000, 1, 1, 7.426351000595343e-21, 5e-14),
1799 (100000, 1, 1, 4.046923979269977e-40, 5e-14)]
1800
1801 @pytest.mark.parametrize("case", cases)
1802 def test_sf_isf(self, case):
1803 x, a, b, sf, tol = case
1804 assert_allclose(stats.johnsonsu.sf(x, a, b), sf, rtol=5e-14)
1805 assert_allclose(stats.johnsonsu.isf(sf, a, b), x, rtol=tol)
1806
1807
1808class TestJohnsonb:
1809 # reference values were computed via mpmath
1810 # from mpmath import mp
1811 # mp.dps = 50
1812 # def johnsonb_sf(x, a, b):
1813 # x = mp.mpf(x)
1814 # a = mp.mpf(a)
1815 # b = mp.mpf(b)
1816 # return float(mp.ncdf(-(a + b * mp.log(x/(mp.one - x)))))
1817 # Order is x, a, b, sf, isf atol
1818 # (Can't expect full precision when the ISF input is very nearly 1)
1819 cases = [(1e-4, 1, 1, 0.9999999999999999, 1e-7),
1820 (0.9999, 1, 1, 8.921114313932308e-25, 5e-14),
1821 (0.999999, 1, 1, 5.815197487181902e-50, 5e-14)]
1822
1823 @pytest.mark.parametrize("case", cases)
1824 def test_sf_isf(self, case):
1825 x, a, b, sf, tol = case
1826 assert_allclose(stats.johnsonsb.sf(x, a, b), sf, rtol=5e-14)
1827 assert_allclose(stats.johnsonsb.isf(sf, a, b), x, atol=tol)
1828
1829
1830class TestLogistic:
1831 # gh-6226
1832 def test_cdf_ppf(self):
1833 x = np.linspace(-20, 20)
1834 y = stats.logistic.cdf(x)
1835 xx = stats.logistic.ppf(y)
1836 assert_allclose(x, xx)
1837
1838 def test_sf_isf(self):
1839 x = np.linspace(-20, 20)
1840 y = stats.logistic.sf(x)
1841 xx = stats.logistic.isf(y)
1842 assert_allclose(x, xx)
1843
1844 def test_extreme_values(self):
1845 # p is chosen so that 1 - (1 - p) == p in double precision
1846 p = 9.992007221626409e-16
1847 desired = 34.53957599234088
1848 assert_allclose(stats.logistic.ppf(1 - p), desired)
1849 assert_allclose(stats.logistic.isf(p), desired)
1850
1851 def test_logpdf_basic(self):
1852 logp = stats.logistic.logpdf([-15, 0, 10])
1853 # Expected values computed with mpmath with 50 digits of precision.
1854 expected = [-15.000000611804547,
1855 -1.3862943611198906,
1856 -10.000090797798434]
1857 assert_allclose(logp, expected, rtol=1e-13)
1858
1859 def test_logpdf_extreme_values(self):
1860 logp = stats.logistic.logpdf([800, -800])
1861 # For such large arguments, logpdf(x) = -abs(x) when computed
1862 # with 64 bit floating point.
1863 assert_equal(logp, [-800, -800])
1864
1865 @pytest.mark.parametrize("loc_rvs,scale_rvs", [(0.4484955, 0.10216821),
1866 (0.62918191, 0.74367064)])
1867 def test_fit(self, loc_rvs, scale_rvs):
1868 data = stats.logistic.rvs(size=100, loc=loc_rvs, scale=scale_rvs)
1869
1870 # test that result of fit method is the same as optimization
1871 def func(input, data):
1872 a, b = input
1873 n = len(data)
1874 x1 = np.sum(np.exp((data - a) / b) /
1875 (1 + np.exp((data - a) / b))) - n / 2
1876 x2 = np.sum(((data - a) / b) *
1877 ((np.exp((data - a) / b) - 1) /
1878 (np.exp((data - a) / b) + 1))) - n
1879 return x1, x2
1880
1881 expected_solution = root(func, stats.logistic._fitstart(data), args=(
1882 data,)).x
1883 fit_method = stats.logistic.fit(data)
1884
1885 # other than computational variances, the fit method and the solution
1886 # to this system of equations are equal
1887 assert_allclose(fit_method, expected_solution, atol=1e-30)
1888
1889 def test_fit_comp_optimizer(self):
1890 data = stats.logistic.rvs(size=100, loc=0.5, scale=2)
1891 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.logistic, data)
1892 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.logistic, data, floc=1)
1893 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.logistic, data, fscale=1)
1894
1895 @pytest.mark.parametrize('testlogcdf', [True, False])
1896 def test_logcdfsf_tails(self, testlogcdf):
1897 # Test either logcdf or logsf. By symmetry, we can use the same
1898 # expected values for both by switching the sign of x for logsf.
1899 x = np.array([-10000, -800, 17, 50, 500])
1900 if testlogcdf:
1901 y = stats.logistic.logcdf(x)
1902 else:
1903 y = stats.logistic.logsf(-x)
1904 # The expected values were computed with mpmath.
1905 expected = [-10000.0, -800.0, -4.139937633089748e-08,
1906 -1.9287498479639178e-22, -7.124576406741286e-218]
1907 assert_allclose(y, expected, rtol=2e-15)
1908
1909 def test_fit_gh_18176(self):
1910 # logistic.fit returned `scale < 0` for this data. Check that this has
1911 # been fixed.
1912 data = np.array([-459, 37, 43, 45, 45, 48, 54, 55, 58]
1913 + [59] * 3 + [61] * 9)
1914 # If scale were negative, NLLF would be infinite, so this would fail
1915 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.logistic, data)
1916
1917
1918class TestLogser:
1919 def setup_method(self):
1920 np.random.seed(1234)
1921
1922 def test_rvs(self):
1923 vals = stats.logser.rvs(0.75, size=(2, 50))
1924 assert_(numpy.all(vals >= 1))
1925 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
1926 assert_(vals.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
1927 val = stats.logser.rvs(0.75)
1928 assert_(isinstance(val, int))
1929 val = stats.logser(0.75).rvs(3)
1930 assert_(isinstance(val, numpy.ndarray))
1931 assert_(val.dtype.char in typecodes['AllInteger'])
1932
1933 def test_pmf_small_p(self):
1934 m = stats.logser.pmf(4, 1e-20)
1935 # The expected value was computed using mpmath:
1936 # >>> import mpmath
1937 # >>> mpmath.mp.dps = 64
1938 # >>> k = 4
1939 # >>> p = mpmath.mpf('1e-20')
1940 # >>> float(-(p**k)/k/mpmath.log(1-p))
1941 # 2.5e-61
1942 # It is also clear from noticing that for very small p,
1943 # log(1-p) is approximately -p, and the formula becomes
1944 # p**(k-1) / k
1945 assert_allclose(m, 2.5e-61)
1946
1947 def test_mean_small_p(self):
1948 m = stats.logser.mean(1e-8)
1949 # The expected mean was computed using mpmath:
1950 # >>> import mpmath
1951 # >>> mpmath.dps = 60
1952 # >>> p = mpmath.mpf('1e-8')
1953 # >>> float(-p / ((1 - p)*mpmath.log(1 - p)))
1954 # 1.000000005
1955 assert_allclose(m, 1.000000005)
1956
1957
1958class TestGumbel_r_l:
1959 @pytest.fixture(scope='function')
1960 def rng(self):
1961 return np.random.default_rng(1234)
1962
1963 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dist", [stats.gumbel_r, stats.gumbel_l])
1964 @pytest.mark.parametrize("loc_rvs", [-1, 0, 1])
1965 @pytest.mark.parametrize("scale_rvs", [.1, 1, 5])
1966 @pytest.mark.parametrize('fix_loc, fix_scale',
1967 ([True, False], [False, True]))
1968 def test_fit_comp_optimizer(self, dist, loc_rvs, scale_rvs,
1969 fix_loc, fix_scale, rng):
1970 data = dist.rvs(size=100, loc=loc_rvs, scale=scale_rvs,
1971 random_state=rng)
1972
1973 kwds = dict()
1974 # the fixed location and scales are arbitrarily modified to not be
1975 # close to the true value.
1976 if fix_loc:
1977 kwds['floc'] = loc_rvs * 2
1978 if fix_scale:
1979 kwds['fscale'] = scale_rvs * 2
1980
1981 # test that the gumbel_* fit method is better than super method
1982 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(dist, data, **kwds)
1983
1984 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dist, sgn", [(stats.gumbel_r, 1),
1985 (stats.gumbel_l, -1)])
1986 def test_fit(self, dist, sgn):
1987 z = sgn*np.array([3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3.00000001])
1988 loc, scale = dist.fit(z)
1989 # The expected values were computed with mpmath with 60 digits
1990 # of precision.
1991 assert_allclose(loc, sgn*3.0000000001667906)
1992 assert_allclose(scale, 1.2495222465145514e-09, rtol=1e-6)
1993
1994
1995class TestPareto:
1996 def test_stats(self):
1997 # Check the stats() method with some simple values. Also check
1998 # that the calculations do not trigger RuntimeWarnings.
1999 with warnings.catch_warnings():
2000 warnings.simplefilter("error", RuntimeWarning)
2001
2002 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(0.5, moments='mvsk')
2003 assert_equal(m, np.inf)
2004 assert_equal(v, np.inf)
2005 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2006 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2007
2008 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(1.0, moments='mvsk')
2009 assert_equal(m, np.inf)
2010 assert_equal(v, np.inf)
2011 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2012 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2013
2014 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(1.5, moments='mvsk')
2015 assert_equal(m, 3.0)
2016 assert_equal(v, np.inf)
2017 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2018 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2019
2020 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(2.0, moments='mvsk')
2021 assert_equal(m, 2.0)
2022 assert_equal(v, np.inf)
2023 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2024 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2025
2026 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(2.5, moments='mvsk')
2027 assert_allclose(m, 2.5 / 1.5)
2028 assert_allclose(v, 2.5 / (1.5*1.5*0.5))
2029 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2030 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2031
2032 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(3.0, moments='mvsk')
2033 assert_allclose(m, 1.5)
2034 assert_allclose(v, 0.75)
2035 assert_equal(s, np.nan)
2036 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2037
2038 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(3.5, moments='mvsk')
2039 assert_allclose(m, 3.5 / 2.5)
2040 assert_allclose(v, 3.5 / (2.5*2.5*1.5))
2041 assert_allclose(s, (2*4.5/0.5)*np.sqrt(1.5/3.5))
2042 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2043
2044 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(4.0, moments='mvsk')
2045 assert_allclose(m, 4.0 / 3.0)
2046 assert_allclose(v, 4.0 / 18.0)
2047 assert_allclose(s, 2*(1+4.0)/(4.0-3) * np.sqrt((4.0-2)/4.0))
2048 assert_equal(k, np.nan)
2049
2050 m, v, s, k = stats.pareto.stats(4.5, moments='mvsk')
2051 assert_allclose(m, 4.5 / 3.5)
2052 assert_allclose(v, 4.5 / (3.5*3.5*2.5))
2053 assert_allclose(s, (2*5.5/1.5) * np.sqrt(2.5/4.5))
2054 assert_allclose(k, 6*(4.5**3 + 4.5**2 - 6*4.5 - 2)/(4.5*1.5*0.5))
2055
2056 def test_sf(self):
2057 x = 1e9
2058 b = 2
2059 scale = 1.5
2060 p = stats.pareto.sf(x, b, loc=0, scale=scale)
2061 expected = (scale/x)**b # 2.25e-18
2062 assert_allclose(p, expected)
2063
2064 @pytest.fixture(scope='function')
2065 def rng(self):
2066 return np.random.default_rng(1234)
2067
2068 @pytest.mark.filterwarnings("ignore:invalid value encountered in "
2069 "double_scalars")
2070 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_shape", [1, 2])
2071 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_loc", [0, 2])
2072 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_scale", [1, 5])
2073 def test_fit(self, rvs_shape, rvs_loc, rvs_scale, rng):
2074 data = stats.pareto.rvs(size=100, b=rvs_shape, scale=rvs_scale,
2075 loc=rvs_loc, random_state=rng)
2076
2077 # shape can still be fixed with multiple names
2078 shape_mle_analytical1 = stats.pareto.fit(data, floc=0, f0=1.04)[0]
2079 shape_mle_analytical2 = stats.pareto.fit(data, floc=0, fix_b=1.04)[0]
2080 shape_mle_analytical3 = stats.pareto.fit(data, floc=0, fb=1.04)[0]
2081 assert (shape_mle_analytical1 == shape_mle_analytical2 ==
2082 shape_mle_analytical3 == 1.04)
2083
2084 # data can be shifted with changes to `loc`
2085 data = stats.pareto.rvs(size=100, b=rvs_shape, scale=rvs_scale,
2086 loc=(rvs_loc + 2), random_state=rng)
2087 shape_mle_a, loc_mle_a, scale_mle_a = stats.pareto.fit(data, floc=2)
2088 assert_equal(scale_mle_a + 2, data.min())
2089
2090 data_shift = data - 2
2091 ndata = data_shift.shape[0]
2092 assert_equal(shape_mle_a,
2093 ndata / np.sum(np.log(data_shift/data_shift.min())))
2094 assert_equal(loc_mle_a, 2)
2095
2096 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_shape", [.1, 2])
2097 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_loc", [0, 2])
2098 @pytest.mark.parametrize("rvs_scale", [1, 5])
2099 @pytest.mark.parametrize('fix_shape, fix_loc, fix_scale',
2100 [p for p in product([True, False], repeat=3)
2101 if False in p])
2102 @np.errstate(invalid="ignore")
2103 def test_fit_MLE_comp_optimizer(self, rvs_shape, rvs_loc, rvs_scale,
2104 fix_shape, fix_loc, fix_scale, rng):
2105 data = stats.pareto.rvs(size=100, b=rvs_shape, scale=rvs_scale,
2106 loc=rvs_loc, random_state=rng)
2107
2108 kwds = {}
2109 if fix_shape:
2110 kwds['f0'] = rvs_shape
2111 if fix_loc:
2112 kwds['floc'] = rvs_loc
2113 if fix_scale:
2114 kwds['fscale'] = rvs_scale
2115
2116 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.pareto, data, **kwds)
2117
2118 @np.errstate(invalid="ignore")
2119 def test_fit_known_bad_seed(self):
2120 # Tests a known seed and set of parameters that would produce a result
2121 # would violate the support of Pareto if the fit method did not check
2122 # the constraint `fscale + floc < min(data)`.
2123 shape, location, scale = 1, 0, 1
2124 data = stats.pareto.rvs(shape, location, scale, size=100,
2125 random_state=np.random.default_rng(2535619))
2126 _assert_less_or_close_loglike(stats.pareto, data)
2127
2128 def test_fit_warnings(self):
2129 assert_fit_warnings(stats.pareto)
2130 # `floc` that causes invalid negative data
2131 assert_raises(FitDataError, stats.pareto.fit, [1, 2, 3], floc=2)
2132 # `floc` and `fscale` combination causes invalid data
2133 assert_raises(FitDataError, stats.pareto.fit, [5, 2, 3], floc=1,
2134 fscale=3)
2135
2136 def test_negative_data(self, rng):
2137 data = stats.pareto.rvs(loc=-130, b=1, size=100, random_state=rng)
2138 assert_array_less(data, 0)
2139 # The purpose of this test is to make sure that no runtime warnings are
2140 # raised for all negative data, not the output of the fit method. Other
2141 # methods test the output but have to silence warnings from the super
2142 # method.
2143 _ = stats.pareto.fit(data)
2144
2145
2146class TestGenpareto:
2147 def test_ab(self):
2148 # c >= 0: a, b = [0, inf]
2149 for c in [1., 0.]:
2150 c = np.asarray(c)
2151 a, b = stats.genpareto._get_support(c)
2152 assert_equal(a, 0.)
2153 assert_(np.isposinf(b))
2154
2155 # c < 0: a=0, b=1/|c|
2156 c = np.asarray(-2.)
2157 a, b = stats.genpareto._get_support(c)
2158 assert_allclose([a, b], [0., 0.5])
2159
2160 def test_c0(self):
2161 # with c=0, genpareto reduces to the exponential distribution
2162 # rv = stats.genpareto(c=0.)
2163 rv = stats.genpareto(c=0.)
2164 x = np.linspace(0, 10., 30)
2165 assert_allclose(rv.pdf(x), stats.expon.pdf(x))
2166 assert_allclose(rv.cdf(x), stats.expon.cdf(x))
2167 assert_allclose(rv.sf(x), stats.expon.sf(x))
2168
2169 q = np.linspace(0., 1., 10)
2170 assert_allclose(rv.ppf(q), stats.expon.ppf(q))
2171
2172 def test_cm1(self):
2173 # with c=-1, genpareto reduces to the uniform distr on [0, 1]
2174 rv = stats.genpareto(c=-1.)
2175 x = np.linspace(0, 10., 30)
2176 assert_allclose(rv.pdf(x), stats.uniform.pdf(x))
2177 assert_allclose(rv.cdf(x), stats.uniform.cdf(x))
2178 assert_allclose(rv.sf(x), stats.uniform.sf(x))
2179
2180 q = np.linspace(0., 1., 10)
2181 assert_allclose(rv.ppf(q), stats.uniform.ppf(q))
2182
2183 # logpdf(1., c=-1) should be zero
2184 assert_allclose(rv.logpdf(1), 0)
2185
2186 def test_x_inf(self):
2187 # make sure x=inf is handled gracefully
2188 rv = stats.genpareto(c=0.1)
2189 assert_allclose([rv.pdf(np.inf), rv.cdf(np.inf)], [0., 1.])
2190 assert_(np.isneginf(rv.logpdf(np.inf)))
2191
2192 rv = stats.genpareto(c=0.)
2193 assert_allclose([rv.pdf(np.inf), rv.cdf(np.inf)], [0., 1.])
2194 assert_(np.isneginf(rv.logpdf(np.inf)))
2195
2196 rv = stats.genpareto(c=-1.)
2197 assert_allclose([rv.pdf(np.inf), rv.cdf(np.inf)], [0., 1.])
2198 assert_(np.isneginf(rv.logpdf(np.inf)))
2199
2200 def test_c_continuity(self):
2201 # pdf is continuous at c=0, -1
2202 x = np.linspace(0, 10, 30)
2203 for c in [0, -1]:
2204 pdf0 = stats.genpareto.pdf(x, c)
2205 for dc in [1e-14, -1e-14]:
2206 pdfc = stats.genpareto.pdf(x, c + dc)
2207 assert_allclose(pdf0, pdfc, atol=1e-12)
2208
2209 cdf0 = stats.genpareto.cdf(x, c)
2210 for dc in [1e-14, 1e-14]:
2211 cdfc = stats.genpareto.cdf(x, c + dc)
2212 assert_allclose(cdf0, cdfc, atol=1e-12)
2213
2214 def test_c_continuity_ppf(self):
2215 q = np.r_[np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1),
2216 np.linspace(0.01, 1, 30, endpoint=False),
2217 1. - np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1)]
2218 for c in [0., -1.]:
2219 ppf0 = stats.genpareto.ppf(q, c)
2220 for dc in [1e-14, -1e-14]:
2221 ppfc = stats.genpareto.ppf(q, c + dc)
2222 assert_allclose(ppf0, ppfc, atol=1e-12)
2223
2224 def test_c_continuity_isf(self):
2225 q = np.r_[np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1),
2226 np.linspace(0.01, 1, 30, endpoint=False),
2227 1. - np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1)]
2228 for c in [0., -1.]:
2229 isf0 = stats.genpareto.isf(q, c)
2230 for dc in [1e-14, -1e-14]:
2231 isfc = stats.genpareto.isf(q, c + dc)
2232 assert_allclose(isf0, isfc, atol=1e-12)
2233
2234 def test_cdf_ppf_roundtrip(self):
2235 # this should pass with machine precision. hat tip @pbrod
2236 q = np.r_[np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1),
2237 np.linspace(0.01, 1, 30, endpoint=False),
2238 1. - np.logspace(1e-12, 0.01, base=0.1)]
2239 for c in [1e-8, -1e-18, 1e-15, -1e-15]:
2240 assert_allclose(stats.genpareto.cdf(stats.genpareto.ppf(q, c), c),
2241 q, atol=1e-15)
2242
2243 def test_logsf(self):
2244 logp = stats.genpareto.logsf(1e10, .01, 0, 1)
2245 assert_allclose(logp, -1842.0680753952365)
2246
2247 # Values in 'expected_stats' are
2248 # [mean, variance, skewness, excess kurtosis].
2249 @pytest.mark.parametrize(
2250 'c, expected_stats',
2251 [(0, [1, 1, 2, 6]),
2252 (1/4, [4/3, 32/9, 10/np.sqrt(2), np.nan]),
2253 (1/9, [9/8, (81/64)*(9/7), (10/9)*np.sqrt(7), 754/45]),
2254 (-1, [1/2, 1/12, 0, -6/5])])
2255 def test_stats(self, c, expected_stats):
2256 result = stats.genpareto.stats(c, moments='mvsk')
2257 assert_allclose(result, expected_stats, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-15)
2258
2259 def test_var(self):
2260 # Regression test for gh-11168.
2261 v = stats.genpareto.var(1e-8)
2262 assert_allclose(v, 1.000000040000001, rtol=1e-13)
2263
2264
2265class TestPearson3:
2266 def setup_method(self):
2267 np.random.seed(1234)
2268
2269 def test_rvs(self):
2270 vals = stats.pearson3.rvs(0.1, size=(2, 50))
2271 assert_(numpy.shape(vals) == (2, 50))
